homepage.pomodoro_description: is a simple yet extremely effective time management method that helps you increase focus, improve productivity, and sustain mental energy.
homepage.steps_title: 5 STEPS TO IMPLEMENT A POMODORO CYCLE
homepage.step1_description: Identify a specific task you need to complete.
homepage.step2_description: Use a timer and set it for
homepage.step3_description: on the chosen task during this time.
homepage.step4_description: When the time is up, mark one Pomodoro as complete and take a break of
homepage.step5_description1: After completing 4 Pomodoros, take a longer break of
homepage.benefits_title: THE OUTSTANDING BENEFITS OF THE POMODORO TECHNIQUE
homepage.benefit1: By working in short intervals, you can easily maintain high levels of focus and avoid information overload.
homepage.benefit2: Tracking the number of Pomodoros for each task helps you plan and estimate time for future tasks more accurately.
homepage.benefit3: Regular short and long breaks allow your brain and body to recover, preventing burnout and sustaining work energy.
homepage.benefit4: You can flexibly adjust the Pomodoro duration if needed (e.g., 50 minutes â€“ 10 minutes for deep work) to suit your focus ability.

q1.title: If I stop paying, will my data be lost?
q1.answer: No. Your data will still be stored, but you wonâ€™t have access to advanced statistics or customization.

q2.title: Can I share the paid plan with others?
q2.answer: No. Each account requires its own subscription since data is stored individually.

q3.title: Will upgrading to Pro help me study more effectively?
q3.answer: Pro includes advanced tools: detailed tracking, visual charts, and personalized study suggestions. This helps you stay focused and manage time better.

q4.title: Should I upgrade if I only study 1â€“2 hours per day?
q4.answer: Not necessary. Free plan is enough for light use. Pro is recommended for a more in-depth and long-term learning experience.
